sentences.en: a hunger for success
sentences.cn: 对成功的渴望

sentences.en: A terrible restlessness that was like to hunger afflicted Martin Eden.
sentences.cn: 一阵可怕的、跟饥饿差不多的不安情绪折磨着马丁·伊登.

sentences.en: But Jules was not eager for classroom learning, he hungered for adventure.
sentences.cn: 但是朱尔斯并不热衷于课堂学习，他渴望冒险。

sentences.en: Coca is well-known for reducing hunger, thirst and fatigue.
sentences.cn: 人们都知道可乐能消饿、止渴和解乏。

sentences.en: Geffen has a hunger for success that seems bottomless.
sentences.cn: 格芬的成功欲望似乎永无止境。

sentences.en: her hunger for knowledge
sentences.cn: 她的求知欲

sentences.en: His hunger for excitement got him into a lot of trouble.
sentences.cn: 他寻求刺激的欲望给他添了许多麻烦.

sentences.en: Hunger made him hallucinate.
sentences.cn: 饥饿使他产生了幻觉。

sentences.en: It is better to die of repletion than to endure hunger.
sentences.cn: 饱死胜过挨饿.

sentences.en: It's commonplace to see people collapsing from hunger in the streets.
sentences.cn: 在街上看见有人饿晕是很平常的事。

sentences.en: It's terrible to hunger for news when the family's letters don't arrive!
sentences.cn: 盼望音信而家书却不到,那滋味可真是难受 啊 !

sentences.en: Most of the people were ground down by hunger and poverty.
sentences.cn: 大多数人受着饥饿和贫穷的折磨.

sentences.en: Most of these will be fleeing cold and hunger, rather than fighting.
sentences.cn: 这些人中的大部分会因饥寒交迫而逃亡，而不是因为战争。

sentences.en: Provide the bare necessities of life, especially food; keep away hunger.
sentences.cn: 供给生活必需品, 特别是食物, 以免于饥饿.

sentences.en: Sugar gives quick relief to hunger but provides no lasting nourishment.
sentences.cn: 糖能快速缓解饥饿感，但不能提供持久的营养。

sentences.en: The meat they'd managed to procure assuaged their hunger.
sentences.cn: 他们把搞到手的肉拿来充饥。

sentences.en: The mere mention of food had triggered off hunger pangs.
sentences.cn: 单单提到食物就引起了阵阵饥饿感。

sentences.en: They cannot sleep for hunger.
sentences.cn: 他们饿得睡不着。

sentences.en: Thousands of people are dying from hunger every day.
sentences.cn: 每天都有成千上万的人死于饥饿。

sentences.en: Try to satisfy your hunger by eating some fruit.
sentences.cn: 吃些水果充充饥吧。

words.tran_cn: 饥饿的；渴望的；荒年的；不毛的

trans.tran_en: lack of food, especially for a long period of time, that can cause illness or death
If you say that someone hungers for something or hungers after it, you are emphasizing that they want it very much
